Description: Sherd of pottery vessel, probably a kiln-support; akin to a dinos rim, but roughly finished and with a pre-firing inscription on the inside, more or less impossible for a dinos. Micaceous red-brown clay. Drilled for analysis.
Curator's comments: The character of the piece is seen better when considered together with comparable items in the British Museum and elsewhere; see Johnston, www.britishmuseum.org/pdf/johnston_ceramic_incriptions 17-18.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 648)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.55 Table 1, p. 65 fig. 44)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 183-4, NAU 158, pl. 35c-d)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TG.4)
